definition: to join/to fit/to mate/to mix/to match/to deserve/to make up (a prescription)/to allocate
medicine/drug/substance used for a specific purpose (e.g. poisoning, explosion, fermenting)/CL:種|种[zhong3],服[fu4],味[wei4]/to poison
leaf of the iris/variant of 藥|药[yao4]

sentences.english: As pharmacy chains face squeezes on profit margins, the use of techs is growing.
sentences.chinese: 配药连锁店由于利润幅度紧缩，使用的技工越来越多。

sentences.english: Get this prescription filled and go straight to bed.
sentences.chinese: 拿这张药方去配药，然后马上去睡觉。

sentences.english: A novel dispensing device belongs to the technical field of medical appliance.
sentences.chinese: 新型配药器，属于医疗用具技术领域。

sentences.english: It may be necessary to gently knead the tube prior to dispensing.
sentences.chinese: 它可能是必要的，轻轻揉管前配药。

sentences.english: The doctor dispensed a prescription to his patient.
sentences.chinese: 医生开处方给病人配药。

sentences.english: A book containing a list of pharmaceutical substances along with their formulas, uses, and methods of preparation.
sentences.chinese: 配方书，处方集，药典一本列有配药材料以及。

sentences.english: Pharmaceutical companies are developing vaccines against H1N1.
sentences.chinese: 配药学的公司在研制对抗H1N1的疫苗。

sentences.english: The gel can be obtained with a prescription only from compounding pharmacists.
sentences.chinese: 这种凝胶只有持配药师所开的处方才能获得。

sentences.english: This includes overuse, when drugs are dispensed too liberally.
sentences.chinese: 这一问题包括过分自由配药造成的滥用。

sentences.english: However, you must make this request each time you get a prescription filled.
sentences.chinese: 每次配药你均须如此请求。

sentences.english: Subsequently, Sun Feng to the hospital, "doctor, " dispensing.
sentences.chinese: 随后，孙峰到医院“看病”配药。

sentences.english: Our drug store has filled prescriptions without mistakes for fifty years.
sentences.chinese: 本药房按方配药，五十年无差错。

sentences.english: The ugly druggist gauged the huge plug in the refugee's rug.
sentences.chinese: 貌寝的配药师测量了难平易近毛毯中的巨年夜插头。

sentences.english: PhRMA is spending milli ons on advertising to support the plan.
sentences.chinese: 配药学研究和生产支持这个计划花了上百万的广告费。

sentences.english: A：Excuse me, sir. I have a prescription to fill.

definition: to make up a prescription (of herbal medicine)
medicine/drug/substance used for a specific purpose (e.g. poisoning, explosion, fermenting)/CL:種|种[zhong3],服[fu4],味[wei4]/to poison
leaf of the iris/variant of 藥|药[yao4]
to visit a doctor/to see a patient
to compound (medicines etc)/to prepare (by mixing ingredients)/to concoct
